  physical_appearance: This is a lantern stand. It is decorated in red and black paint with gilded carvings. It has a hexagonal shape
 with several segments. The carved openwork panels depict animals
 human figures
 and floral patterns. The base features lion heads at each corner
 with a panel showing claws clutching a ball. The gilding is slightly faded especially along the base.

  subject_terms_1: lanterns (lighting devices) commissions (orders for works) lion\u0027s head (motif) carvings (visual works) gifts

  subject_terms_2: Stands (Furniture) Motifs Gifts Lanterns

  subject_terms_3: Decorative arts

  sgcool_label_text: This stand accompanies a lantern said to have been given to the Marquess and Marchioness Dalhousie by the merchants of Singapore during their visit to Singapore in 1850. \r\n\r\nThe carved openwork panels depict animals
 human figures
 and floral patterns. The base features ferocious heads at the corners. Emerging from the mouth of each beast is a claw clutching a ball
 a typical motif seen in Chinese furniture of the period. \r\n

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a lantern stand. It is decorated in red and black paint with gilded carvings. It has a hexagonal shape, with several segments. The carved openwork panels depict animals, human figures, and floral patterns. The base features lion heads at each corner, with a panel showing claws clutching a ball. The gilding is slightly faded especially along the base.
metadata.subject_terms_1: lanterns (lighting devices) commissions (orders for works) lion's head (motif) carvings (visual works) gifts
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This stand accompanies a lantern said to have been given to the Marquess and Marchioness Dalhousie by the merchants of Singapore during their visit to Singapore in 1850. 

The carved openwork panels depict animals, human figures, and floral patterns. The base features ferocious heads at the corners. Emerging from the mouth of each beast is a claw clutching a ball, a typical motif seen in Chinese furniture of the period.
